common_issues.title: LTM and Workstream Issues on macOS
common_issues.description: Users on macOS are experiencing issues with LTM and Workstream functionality, including queries not returning results, slow performance, and failure to record new activities.  Some users report that clearing LTM data temporarily resolves the issue.  Additionally, Pro users are encountering errors suggesting they need to upgrade despite having a Pro subscription.

related_issues.title: Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
related_issues.text:
Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
related_issues.text:
I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using Pieces I asked, "what did I work today?" and I received an error that says `I'm sorry. This feature requires Pieces Pro. Please upgrade your plan or change your LLM to continue.`  When I have paid for pro and am signed in. What I expect is that I can use my paid pro membership to run query and not receive an error.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS services failing to open on MacOS
common_issues.description: Multiple users are unable to open Pieces Settings Service or Pieces Core Services on MacOS.  The Settings Service issue involves a type registration error within GetIt, while the Core Services issue points to a WebSocket connection failure with a 404 error.  Suggested solutions include checking PiecesOS installation, verifying port availability, and ensuring network connectivity.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service fails to open on MacOS
common_issues.description: Users are unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service on MacOS.  Two distinct errors are observed: "Instance of 'fp'" and "HttpException: Connection reset by peer." Affected users are running MacOS versions 15.5 and 15.6 on Apple M3 processors. Pieces OS versions range from 11.0.4 to 12.1.1.  Further investigation into the 'fp' instance error and connection reset issues is needed. Ensure Pieces OS version compatibility and check network connectivity.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Desktop Application Malfunctioning
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with the Pieces OS desktop application, including unresponsive hotkeys on macOS, LTM recording failures after approximately 20 minutes, and workstream summary generation errors on Windows.  The hotkey issue involves all key combinations producing the macOS error sound without triggering any application function. The LTM and workstream issues may involve application or system conflicts.  Recommended troubleshooting includes checking system compatibility, reinstalling the application, and verifying software updates.

related_issues.title: No hotkeys work
related_issues.text:
No hotkeys work
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

None of the hotkeys work at all. Every hotkey combination produces the macos sound and nothing happens. No keys at all do anything, hotkey or not - they all produce that same macos sound and nothing happens.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various bugs in the Pieces desktop application, including issues with dragging files into conversation context, unresponsive hotkeys, and automatic redirection to support upon launch.  These issues span different operating systems (Windows and macOS) and Pieces OS versions (12.1.0, 12.1.1, 12.2.0).  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and implement fixes.

related_issues.title: CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
related_issues.text:
CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. CANNOT drag a file into CONVERSATION CONTEXT
2. the window for file choosing sometimes pops out back (not front)
3. filter rules only applies to certain files, for example, .jsonl is excluded

recommendations: Prioritize resolving issues related to Pieces Copilot and Settings Services on MacOS, given their high activity levels and impact on core functionality.
Investigate LTM and Workstream issues on MacOS, focusing on performance, data limits, and subscription validation.
Address Pieces OS desktop application malfunctions, including hotkey responsiveness, LTM recording failures, and workstream summary generation errors, across both MacOS and Windows.
Improve error handling and messaging within the Pieces OS application, providing clearer guidance to users experiencing issues such as the "Instance of 'fp'" error.
Review and update documentation regarding Pieces OS installation, port availability, and network connectivity requirements to preemptively address common user issues.
